sect2.para: The eclplus executable accepts command line parameters to send directly to an ECL execution engine. These options can be typed directly on the command line, sent using a script or batch file, through an ini file, or any combination.

sect3.title: Workunit manipulation
sect3.para: A workunit is a data structure that is passed among eclplus, daliserver, and eclccserver. It contains real-time information about the query, so you can control the process of a query by manipulating the workunit.

sect3.title: List all work units
sect3.para: To list all work units:

sect3.title: Timeout
sect3.para: Before you run a query, if you know the query is going to take a long time, you can specify a timeout, then your eclplus will return when it reaches the timeout, and the query will run in the background.
For example:
eclplus will return immediately.
eclplus will return in 2 seconds.
You can list/view the workunit associated with the query to monitor its status.

sect3.title: Output format
sect3.para: By default, the result displays on the screen. You can direct it to a file, by using the output option:
sect3.programlisting: eclplus @datasetquery.txt output=o1.txt cat o1.txt firstname lastname Yanrui Ma Richard Taylor Richard Chapman
sect3.para: Also, you may specify the following output formats:

sect3.title: raw
sect3.programlisting: eclplus @datasetquery.txt format=raw Yanrui Ma Richard Taylor Richard Chapman

sect3.title: runecl
sect3.programlisting: eclplus @datasetquery.txt format=runecl [QUERY 0] [0] firstname -> Yanrui lastname -> Ma [1] firstname -> Richard lastname -> Taylor [2] firstname -> Richard lastname -> Chapman

sect3.title: bin(ary)
sect3.programlisting: eclplus @datasetquery.txt format=bin Yanrui Ma Richard Taylor Richard Chapman

sect3.para: Assuming you have the eclplus.ini file as listed above, when you run eclplus without any options you will enter interactive mode:
